When computing vertex normals, if normals of vertices around a single point are less than or equal to this angle (in degrees) apart from each other, they will

, care is taken when computing normals to try to avoid issues introduced by sliver polygons and to weight contributions to normals by angle, so that triangulation won’t change normals significantly.
